articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken visits Egypt and Israel on Monday hoping to deliver the ceasefire that President Joe Biden proposed last month, in an all-out push by Washington to secure an end to the Gaza war.
articles.title: Blinken in Middle East to push ceasefire while Israeli troops advance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An aircraft carrying Malawi's Vice President Saulos Klaus Chilima and nine others has gone missing, Malawi's presidency said on Monday.
articles.title: Aircraft carrying Malawi vice president missing, presidency says

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council will vote later on Monday on U.S.-drafted resolution backing a proposal outlined by President Joe Biden for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas in the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: UN Security Council to vote on plan for Israel-Hamas ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France began to gear up for elections on Monday, after President Emmanuel Macron called a shock snap legislative election following a bruising loss in the European Parliament vote to the far-right party of Marine Le Pen.
articles.title: France enters election mode after far-right win in European Parliament vote

articles.author: Jack Queen, Tom Hals
articles.description: The evidence against U.S. President Joe Biden’s son was grim but established that he was guilty of making a false statement about his use of illegal drugs on a background check form when he bought a gun, a government lawyer told a jury on Monday.
articles.title: Hunter Biden evidence 'ugly,' prosecutors tell jury and urge conviction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak unveils his Conservatives' agenda for government on Tuesday, promising to offer voters in an election on July 4 the kind of financial security he says the opposition Labour Party can never provide.
articles.title: Under pressure, Britain's Sunak unveils party election manifesto

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Federal agencies said on Monday they have restored full access for commercial maritime transit through the Port of Baltimore after the removal of 50,000 tons of debris from the March 26 collapse of the Key Bridge.
articles.title: Access fully restored to key channel after Baltimore bridge debris removed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas welcomed on Monday a U.N. Security Council resolution backing a proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza, saying it is ready to cooperate with mediators over implementing the principles of the plan.
articles.title: Hamas welcomes UN Security Council resolution for Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: Moldova's pro-European president signed into law on Monday changes to the criminal code expanding provisions on treason denounced by her opponents and Amnesty International.
articles.title: Moldovan president signs changes to treason law denounced by opposition, Amnesty International

articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: James Lawson, a prominent civil rights leader whose advocacy of nonviolent protest influenced Martin Luther King Jr. and helped shape the 1960s movement to outlaw discrimination in the U.S., died at 95 on Sunday, his family said.
articles.title: James Lawson, US civil rights leader who championed nonviolence, dies at 95
